title: StreamPulse Insights
summary: Real-time telemetry transformed into interactive operations dashboards with proactive alerting for on-call teams.
problem: Operations teams were missing critical anomalies in a sea of logs, leading to costly downtime and pager fatigue.
goal: Deliver a streaming observability experience with clear alerting so responders see what matters within seconds.
approach: Unified disparate telemetry sources into a governed Kafka pipeline, layered dbt models for business-ready metrics, and delivered a realtime UI with progressive disclosure.
results: On-call staff now act on high-signal alerts with shared context in a single workspace, reducing triage loops and improving customer uptime.

title: Forecast Studio
summary: Scenario planning workbench that helps finance and product teams test assumptions with explainable ML forecasts.
problem: Planning teams relied on brittle spreadsheets that broke under new scenarios and provided no traceability back to source data.
goal: Launch an explainable forecasting application that lets teams iterate on assumptions and share updates with confidence.
approach: Built a modular feature store, automated backtesting harness, and an interactive React front-end that visualises forecast uncertainty with human-readable insights.
results: Stakeholders can now simulate product launches and budget shifts in minutes while keeping an auditable trail of every change.

metrics.label: Scenario turnaround
metrics.description: Speed to produce new forecast scenarios.

title: Unified Metrics Hub
summary: Centralised metrics platform standardising KPIs and refreshing executive scorecards in minutes instead of hours.
problem: Executives were making decisions from conflicting KPI decks generated by hand with stale extracts.
goal: Provide a governed metrics hub that syncs definitions across teams and automates board-ready scorecards.
approach: Modeled shared dimensions in Snowflake, orchestrated Dagster assets for incremental freshness, and shipped a React experience with row-level security.
results: Leadership now reviews the same trusted KPIs, refreshed nightly, with drill-ins for operational owners.

metrics.label: Report prep time
metrics.description: Reduction in analyst effort per cycle.

title: Atlas Demand Surface
summary: Cluster-aware map visualisation that reveals underserved delivery zones using spatial joins and density scoring.
problem: City planners lacked a single view to spot cluster-level gaps between courier supply and customer demand.
goal: Deliver a performant geospatial explorer that highlights high-potential clusters, overlays demographic context, and exports rollout briefs.
approach: Modeled hex-based tiles in PostGIS, applied DBSCAN clustering to courier telemetry, and rendered multi-layer Mapbox scenes with smooth LOD transitions.
results: Expansion teams now identify viable neighborhoods in minutes and justify capital requests with deeply contextualized maps.

gallery.alt: Atlas Demand Surface showing choropleth clusters with tooltips.
Map overlay comparing courier density vs. demand hotspots.

title: SignalLift Lab
summary: ML-driven lead scoring pipeline pairing feature store governance with an insight-rich reviewer UI.
problem: Revenue ops could not trust opaque scoring spreadsheets and had no way to inspect how signals affected conversion.
goal: Launch a governed ML service with human-friendly explanations so SDRs can prioritize work and learn what drives lift.
approach: Built a Python feature store, trained TensorFlow ranking models, deployed FastAPI endpoints with Canary releases, and surfaced SHAP-driven visuals in a Next.js console.
results: Sales teams triage leads 2x faster while retaining full transparency into the signals that drive a score.

metrics.label: Pipeline velocity
metrics.description: Increase in qualified leads touched per day.

metrics.label: Explained variance
metrics.description: Share of variance captured by top features.

title: OpsPulse Control Tower
summary: Executive-ready Shiny dashboards harmonising IoT telemetry, finance KPIs, and staffing to keep warehouses stable.
problem: Operations leaders swivel-chairs between point solutions and gut feel to manage labor, quality, and throughput each shift.
goal: Provide a single command center with predictive staffing alerts, drill-down dashboards, and automated shift recaps.
approach: Modeled Snowflake fact tables, exposed R Markdown APIs for ML demand curves, and built modular Shiny components published through Posit Connect.
results: Directors now review a single dashboard that pairs live status with predictive guidance, avoiding costly rush staffing.
